summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 between federal prosecutors and attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an individual (likely a pilot or staff member) for documents and information related to Jeffrey Epstein's flights, passengers, and observations of young women/girls. The emails discuss scheduling a call and the scope of the subpoena, which seeks flight manifests, travel records, and information about Epstein's employees and his relationships with young women.

persons.name: Brendan F. Quigley
persons.context: Appears to be an attorney involved in communications regarding a subpoena, coordinating a call time.

persons.name: Andy
persons.context: Addressed in emails, appears to be an attorney representing a subpoenaed individual, coordinating with prosecutors.

persons.name: Brendan
persons.context: Referenced in email salutations, likely an attorney (possibly Brendan F. Quigley) involved in the subpoena matter.

connections.description: Communicating via email regarding scheduling a call and the status of a subpoena response.

events.title: Original subpoena return date
events.description: The original return date for a grand jury subpoena issued to an individual, which prosecutors agreed to hold in abeyance pending discussions.

events.title: Scheduled call regarding subpoena
events.description: A call scheduled for Thursday, December 12, 2019, at 11:30 AM to discuss the subpoena and document collection.

keyFacts: Prosecutors sought flight manifests, flight plans, and travel records from an individual dating back to 2000, related to Jeffrey Epstein's flights.
The subpoena sought information about observations of young women or girls on flights and discussions with Epstein about his relationships with young women/girls or related legal issues.
Prosecutors also sought the identities of Epstein's employees and staff known to the subpoenaed individual.
The email chain indicates delays in response to the subpoena, with follow-ups in July and November 2019 after initial contact.
